channel.title: Losing items on death[PI]
channel.description:
I'm currently using Deathlypvpz v4 and it seems that that source is different from other PI's so I'm coming here for help, hopefully.
http://pastebin.com/eBj7sQEY there's the link for my public void giveLife, I want to make it so players don't lose items on death unless they're in the wild.
I've looked for this and still can't figure it out, thanks in advance!

item.title: Losing items on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @ganch ganch
item.description:
@ganch wrote:

You mind helping through teamviewer or something mate?

Read full topic

item.title: Losing items on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ganch:

I understand it, but I added !c.inWild and they don’t lose items outside and inside of wild

That’d be because you don’t just “add” it. Like I said, you need to remove things.
And I also said not to use the exclamation point, because that is the logical opposite.
So “!c.inWild” would mean if the boolean “inWild” for the Client object is False

Read full topic

I’ve learned enough java coding but I ain’t messed with this source too much

Have you figured it out?

item.title: Losing items on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @ganch ganch
item.description:
@ganch wrote:

So, like this? this is a bit confusing to me lol.

if(c.duelStatus <= 4 && !c.getPA().inPitsWait()) { // if we are not in a duel we must be in wildy so remove items if (!c.inPits && !c.inFightCaves() && !c.inDT() && !c.inPcGame() && !c.inFunPk() && !c.inWild()) { c.getItems().resetKeepItems(); if(c.playerRights == 0) {

Read full topic

item.title: Losing items on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ganch:

So should I add ! c.notinWild or something?

! means the opposite of the condition.

So " ! c.notinWild " would check if the boolean notinWild was false. Assuming that existed.

You need to use the boolean your server uses to check if in wildy or not. In my first reply I said something about what the boolean you need to use might be named.

Read full topic

item.title: Losing items on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @ganch ganch
item.description:
@ganch wrote:

So should I add ! c.notinWild or something?

Read full topic

item.title: Losing items on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ganch:

So do I delete that or…? Still not understanding lol

You need to edit it… Not remove.

Refer to my first reply.

Read full topic

item.title: Losing items on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ganch, post:3, topic:550554”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=669465.msg4476666#msg4476666 date=1426302338]

if(c.duelStatus <= 4 && !c.getPA().inPitsWait()) { // if we are not in a duel we must be in wildy so remove items if (!c.inPits && !c.inFightCaves() && !c.inDT() && !c.inPcGame() && !c.inFunPk()) { c.getItems().resetKeepItems(); if((c.playerRights == 2 && Config.ADMIN_DROP_ITEMS) || c.playerRights != 2) {
In simplest terms, this is the code that checks whether or not the player should lose items.
Essentially, you’d need to make it check if the player is in Wild (Usually there’s a boolean called “inWild()”).
You could probably remove most/all the code in the first if statement and just put “c.inWild()”, but I don’t know how your server works so do not just blindly go and do that.
[/quote]

So change the if((c.playerRights == 2 @@ Config.ADMIN_DROP_ITEMS) || c.playerRights != 2) { to if((c.playerRights == 0) || c.playerRights != 0) {? Or what?[/quote]
I should have said the second one, but no, you’re close.
The line I was more specifically talking about is:

Read full topic

item.title: Losing items on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @ganch ganch
item.description:
@ganch wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:550554”] if(c.duelStatus <= 4 && !c.getPA().inPitsWait()) { // if we are not in a duel we must be in wildy so remove items if (!c.inPits && !c.inFightCaves() && !c.inDT() && !c.inPcGame() && !c.inFunPk()) { c.getItems().resetKeepItems(); if((c.playerRights == 2 && Config.ADMIN_DROP_ITEMS) || c.playerRights != 2) {
In simplest terms, this is the code that checks whether or not the player should lose items.
Essentially, you’d need to make it check if the player is in Wild (Usually there’s a boolean called “inWild()”).
You could probably remove most/all the code in the first if statement and just put “c.inWild()”, but I don’t know how your server works so do not just blindly go and do that.[/quote]

So change the if((c.playerRights == 2 @@ Config.ADMIN_DROP_ITEMS) || c.playerRights != 2) { to if((c.playerRights == 0) || c.playerRights != 0) {? Or what?

Read full topic

item.title: Losing items on death[PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

if(c.duelStatus <= 4 && !c.getPA().inPitsWait()) { // if we are not in a duel we must be in wildy so remove items if (!c.inPits && !c.inFightCaves() && !c.inDT() && !c.inPcGame() && !c.inFunPk()) { c.getItems().resetKeepItems(); if((c.playerRights == 2 && Config.ADMIN_DROP_ITEMS) || c.playerRights != 2) {
In simplest terms, this is the code that checks whether or not the player should lose items.
Essentially, you’d need to make it check if the player is in Wild (Usually there’s a boolean called “inWild()”).
You could probably remove most/all the code in the first if statement and just put “c.inWild()”, but I don’t know how your server works so do not just blindly go and do that.

Read full topic
